meanings.definition: Make mistakes in speaking or writing.
meanings.sent1: I tend to solecise when I get nervous and speak too quickly.
meanings.sent2: It is important to proofread your work to avoid solecising.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor accidentally solecised his lines, making the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to solecise turned her simple email into a confusing mess.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen marked every solecise in the students' essays.

meanings.definition: A mistake in grammar or usage.
meanings.sent1: The teacher pointed out a solecise in my essay and helped me correct it.
meanings.sent2: Grammarly is a useful tool for catching solecises in your writing.
meanings.sent3: The solecise in the official document caused quite a stir in the office.
meanings.sent4: His constant solecises in speech made him the subject of many jokes.
meanings.sent5: The editor's job is to catch and fix any solecises in the manuscript before publishing.
